intro: [WRONG START] Emelia barbeyana, commonly known as the African starfruit or African guava, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. These berries are edible and have a tart, slightly sweet flavor, often used in local cuisines. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks.
